column2: Foe breaks free of a weak grip. You have the initiative next round.
column4: Grab foe and give him a weak punch. He thinks you are dangerous.
column6: Foe recovers, continues his defense by sweeping his weapon at your feet.
column8: Push foe, unbalancing him. You have initiative for 2 rounds.
column10: Strong passing blow near foe's head. His violent evasion is not productive.

column2: Almost get a grip on foe's arm. He avoids his mistake. You gain the initiative next round.
column4: You grip foe's shield arm. Foe's strike towards your head makes you let go of him. He keeps a distance.
column6: Collide with foe. You push him away and he stumbles back 5 feet. It went better than you could have hoped.
column8: Hard, but poorly placed. Foe bounces back out of your grip. He looks like he does not recognize you.
column10: Uncoordinated attack and a little luck, allows foe to escape your grasp. You have initiative for 2 rounds.

column2: Grip to lower back. Foe wards off your attack and prepares for your next move.
column4: Grip fails, but bash does not. You unbalance your foe. You have the initiative.
column6: You attack is almost comical as you seek any grip you can get. All the tiny tugs finally have an effect on foe.
column8: Strike to foe's shield arm. If foe has no shield, you immobilize arm for 6 rounds.
column10: Attack to upper leg. Foe spins to break free. He is disoriented badly. It takes a moment for him to see you.

column2: Hinder foe's weapon arm. Foe violently frees himself and takes a defensive stance.
column4: Pull foe over, he breaks free. He is having trouble recovering. Your heart is broken.
column6: Grab foe's waist. Your grip appeared to be strong, but now it is losing its advantage. Your foe is working free.
column8: Painful grip on foe's hand. You do not break anything, but he thinks so. You have initiative for 4 rounds.
column10: You and foe collide. He breaks your grip and stumbles away. You bounce back and miss a good opportunity.

column2: You get in close and grab at foe's hair. He is daunted and steps back to escape your reach.
column4: Grip to foe's garments. They rip and you lose a hopeful hold. Foe is carried back by his break-away.
column6: Grapple foe's leg and try to lift it up off the ground. Foe slips away, but is off balance while recovering.
column8: Catch foe's waist garments and pull him in. He is in trouble. He seeks to strike your hand and break your hold.
column10: Grip to shield arm. Foe drops his shield as he wails in pain. You try to stay serious.

column2: Foe spins away and comes back to face you. He is unbalanced.
column4: Foe spins out of your grasp. However, spin nullifies his counterattack.
column6: Short fingers render thigh hold ineffectual. Try lower next time.
column8: Grip foe's side and shake him like a rattle. He is disoriented, but gets free.
column10: Grasp around foe's leg proves effective. Foe is unbalanced for a moment.

column2: Grip to arm gives foe a bruised bicep. Foe shakes free and prepares for your assault.
column4: Slipping grasp around foe's waist is weak. He breaks your grip and stumbles out of your way.
column6: Grab foe around waist. Just when you think your grip is iron, he begins to break free. You might still prevail.
column8: Clumsy bear hug around foe. Foe can do little  to scape for the moment. Both his arms are pinned.
column10: You find yourself on foe's shield side. If he has a shield, you are stymied.

column2: Strike foe's weapon, disarming him. Foe fails to recover weapon. He has put himself in a bad spot.
column4: You grab foe's weapon arm and make him drop it with a violent shake. Foe strains wrist trying to break free.
column6: Grab foe, he falls down and you follow. You knock him prone to stand back up. He is down foe 1 round.
column8: Grab leg and flip foe to ground, pinning him. Prone and immobile for 2 rounds, he might surrender.
column10: Grasp foe around neck and bring him to ground. Muscles and tendons tear. Foe is prone and immobilized for 3 rounds.

column2: Passing chest strike. Foe eludes grapple, keeps defensive stance.
column4: Grip foe's neck. Push foe's chin back steadily. He should act soon, or...
column6: Grab foe's shield arm. If foe has shield you grapple it. Until dropped: -50
column8: Foe barely escapes immobilization, but must recover from the ordeal.
column10: You almost disarm foe and trip him. He uses weapon arm to prevent his fall.

column2: Grab an exposed garment. Uneasy grip impedes foe's actions.
column4: Weak hold around foe's waist. He brings his knee up and you lose your grip. Foe does not recover quickly.
column6: Very strong grip around foe's waist. Foe is held at a great disadvantage. He might get free.
column8: You grapple foe in a brutal way. Hold proves to be excellent. You have him. What next?
column10: Foe evades your grasp by falling to the ground. A clever ploy. Smile at your good fortune.

column2: Grapple foe's shield arm. If foe has a shield, you pull it down. If foe has no shield, you immobilize his arm.
column4: Entangle foe's shield arm. If foe has shield, your grip makes it impossible to use. Until shield dropped: (-30). If no shield his arm is entangled.
column6: Entangle foe's weapon arm. His weapon is held immobile. He cannot use it, but he will not drop it. He tries to knee you to escape, this fails.
column8: Entangle foe's weapon arm. Foe hangs onto his weapon, but the arm is immobilized. You try to make him strike himself. It fails.
column10: Grab foe's weapon arm and beat on it, without concern for the rest of foe. Foe is disarmed. You tear ligaments and pull muscles.

column2: Useful grip on foe's neck. Foe's face turns red. He cannot breath easily. Slowly he breaks your grip.
column4: Grip around foe's waist unbalances him. You have the initiative. Foe shares much profanity with you.
column6: Brutal grip around foe's chest, leaves bruises all over him. Your assault has created much confusion.
column8: Grab knee and send foe down. He breaks his fall by breaking his shield arm. He is disarmed and prone.
column10: Entangle both of foe's arms and pin them to his body. Foe cannot move his arms and looks ready to surrender.

column2: Grasp foe's leg, lifting it off the ground for a moment. You have the initiative for 6 rounds.
column4: Entangle foe's leg and send him down. He does not hit hard. He pulls a muscle in his leg struggling.
column6: Your assault is strong and lucky. As you grapple foe, you stomp his foot. He falls hard, breaking his shoulder.
column8: Tie up both of foe's arms. He is immobile and cannot fight back effectively. You have him now.
column10: Foe stumbles, with your assistance, and falls. His weapon breaks on impact. If foe has no chest armor, he takes a 'D' Krush.

column2: Entangle foe's leg. Foe is knocked down. Foe lands on his weapon arm. He kicks and breaks free.
column4: Pull foe's legs together. He goes down, hitting hard and dropping his weapon. He feebly attempts to crawl for it.
column6: Painfully immobilize weapon arm. Foe cannot surrender quickly enough to avoid the damage and pain.
column8: Grapple foe's legs and send him over. He hits his head in the fall. You get little resistance after that.
column10: Wrap up foe's legs. Foe tumbles to the ground like a ragdoll breaking both arms and an ankle. Foe is knocked out.

column2: Ride foe down and immobile him. He can do nothing for 12 rounds. You are prone also, while holding him down.
column4: Entangle foe's arm and flip him to ground, fracturing his leg. You immobilize him completely. He is prone, face down and still conscious.
column6: Entangle foe's legs. Grapple weapon arm and break it on an available surface. You send foe to the ground. He falls very hard and is knocked out.
column8: Crushing grip around foe's neck. If no neck armor, foe dies in 6 rounds from your mortal grip. Foe is disarmed.
column9: with neck armor: stun no parry 3x
column10: Attack results in strangling hold. Foe flails legs in desperation. Foe is unable to break free and dies in 9 rounds of helpless struggling. Grim.

column2: Foe's legs are entangled long enough to make him fall. He is knocked out for 5 rounds.
column4: Grip foe's neck in a vicious hold. If foe cannot break your grip in 4 rounds, he will begin to pass out from suffocation.
column6: Grip foe's head and jerk it around. If foe has no neck armor, he dies.
column7: with neck armor: +5H, stun no parry 5x, foe @ -75
column8: Grapple foe's head. His skull is fractured during this assault. If he has no helm, he is in a coma for 30 days.
column10: Crush foe's windpipe and pull the head from his body. You are mighty.
